intro: Catanthera ovata, commonly known as the oval catanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Catanthera ovata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
